meta.description: Current outside air temperature

headline.value: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 31 at 4:04AM PST until February 2 at 9:00AM PST by NWS San Francisco CA

description.value:
* WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, an increased risk of
sneaker waves and strong rip currents with breaking waves of
14 to 19 feet. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to 1.3 ft of
inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas
near shorelines and tidal waterways.

* WHERE...San Francisco and Monterey Bay.

* WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until noon PST Sunday.
For the Beach Hazards Statement, through 9 AM PST Monday
morning.

* IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only
isolated road closures expected. Dangerous conditions are
forecast along the shoreline. Hazards include sneaker waves,
strong rip currents, and large breaking waves.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...At the San Francisco tidal gauge, high
tide is expected to be: 1.3 ft above normal (7.20 ft MLLW) at
9:30 AM Saturday 1/31 and 1.2 ft above normal (6.96 ft MLLW)
at 10:22 AM Sunday 2/1. These predictions include up to 0.3 ft
of storm surge from an incoming moderate to long period swell
that will enhance the astronomical tide and flooding threat.
High tide timing varies up to 90 minutes earlier or later
along the Pacific Coast and through the San Francisco Bay,
respectively.

instruction.value:
If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be
closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of
unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone
property.

Stay off of jetties, piers, rocks, and other waterside
infrastructure. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous surf
and NEVER turn your back on the ocean. Monitor local weather,
surf and tide forecasts at www.weather.gov/mtr.

areaDesc.value: San Francisco; Northern Monterey Bay; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast

headline.value: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 31 at 4:04AM PST until February 1 at 12:00PM PST by NWS San Francisco CA

meta.description: The current tide height  relative to lowest astronomical tide (LAT/Chart Datum)
Next high tide height  relative to lowest astronomical tide (LAT/Chart Datum)
RFC 3339 (UTC only without local offset) string representing date and time.
The next low tide height relative to lowest astronomical tide (LAT/Chart Datum)
RFC 3339 (UTC only without local offset) string representing date and time.
Depth below Transducer
Current water temperature
Current magnetic heading of the vessel, equals 'headingCompass adjusted for magneticDeviation'
Rate of turn (+ve is change to starboard). If the value is AIS RIGHT or LEFT, set to +-0.0206 rads and add warning in notifications

The magnetic variation (declination) at the current position that must be added to the magnetic heading to derive the true heading. Easterly variations are positive and Westerly variations are negative (in Radians).
The position of the vessel in 2 or 3 dimensions (WGS84 datum)
Vessel speed over ground. If converting from AIS 'HIGH' value, set to 102.2 (Ais max value) and add warning in notifications
The current true north heading of the vessel, equals 'headingMagnetic adjusted for magneticVariation'
Course over ground (true)
Seconds since the 1st Jan 1970 that the variation calculation was made
Time and Date from the GNSS Positioning System
Course over ground (magnetic)
Quality of the satellite fix
Number of satellites
Altitude of antenna
Horizontal Dilution of Precision
Difference between WGS84 earth ellipsoid and mean sea level
Age of DGPS data
ID of DGPS base station
Integrity of the satellite fix
Fix type
Vessel attitude: roll, pitch and yaw

roll.description: Vessel roll, +ve is list to starboard

yaw.description: Yaw, +ve is heading change to starboard

meta.description: The distance from the vessel's present position to the closest point on a line (track) between previousPoint and nextPoint. A negative number indicates that the vessel is currently to the left of this line (and thus must steer right to compensate), a positive number means the vessel is to the right of the line (steer left to compensate).
The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to true north.
A reference (URL) to the presently active route, in resources.
The time this route was activated
The position of lastPoint in two dimensions
A reference (URL) to the presently active route, in resources.
The time this route was activated
The position of lastPoint in two dimensions
Calculation type used (GreatCircle or Rhumbline).
The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to true north.
The bearing of a line between previousPoint and nextPoint, relative to magnetic north.

The distance from the vessel's present position to the closest point on a line (track) between previousPoint and nextPoint. A negative number indicates that the vessel is currently to the left of this line (and thus must steer right to compensate), a positive number means the vessel is to the right of the line (steer left to compensate).
The distance in meters between the vessel's present position and the previousPoint.
The distance in meters between the vessel's present position and the nextPoint.
The bearing of a line between the vessel's current position and nextPoint, relative to true north.
The bearing of a line between the vessel's current position and nextPoint, relative to magnetic north.
The velocity component of the vessel towards the nextPoint.
Time in seconds to reach nextPoint's perpendicular with current speed & direction.
The estimated time of arrival at nextPoint position.
Time in seconds to reach final destination with current speed & direction.
The estimated time of arrival at final destination.
The remaining distance along the route to reach the final destination.
The average speed required to arrive at the destination at the targetArrivalTime.
Total distance traveled on this trip / since trip reset
Total distance traveled
Vessel speed through the water
The current state of the engine
Engine revolutions (x60 for RPM)
Trim/tilt state, 0<=ratio<=1, 1 is 100% up
